trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The tenticrablodon can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The tenticrablodon deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The tenticrablodon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Reactive
entries: The tenticrablodon has five reactions. Four of these have to be used for attacks of opportunity with its Tentacle attacks.

The tenticrablodon can use its reaction to to make a melee Tentacle attack against a creature that moves more than 5 feet while within reach of that attack (30 feet). When that attack hits, the creature's speed becomes 0 for the rest of the turn.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the tenticrablodon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tenticrablodon makes two Claw attacks, four Tentacle attacks and one Bite attack.
It may replace any Tentacle attacks with one Constrict attack against all targets grabbed by its Tentacles.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 4d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled}, escape {@dc 20}.
The tenticrablodon can freely move a large or smaller creature  it has {@condition grappled} with a claw within the reach of this claw. This is forced movement.
The tenticrablodon has two claws, each of which can grapple only one target.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}. The tenticrablodon has four tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

action.name: Constrict
entries: Each target {@condition grappled} by a tentacle must make a {@dc 20} Strength save, taking {@damage 5d6 + 5} bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) piercing damage plus {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the tenticrablodon. A swallowed creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the tenticrablodon, and takes {@h}20 ( {@damage 4d6 + 6}) acid damage at the start of each of the tenticrablodons turns.

If the tenticrablodon takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the worm must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the worm.

reaction.name: Shell Defense {@recharge 5}
entries: The tenticrablodon adds 6 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it and further attacks until the beginning of its next turn. To do so, the tenticrablodon must see the attacker.
A weird crustacean with octopus tentacles for legs and a shark head poking out of the front.
• 4 pairs of eyes, 4 tentacles, two claws, one angry shark head
• very, very old - from a previous age or another place scholars do not know
• unknown if tenticrablodon was blueprint for other creatures or vice versa
• lay eggs that are self-fertilised
• are very small (tadpole-sized) on birth, grow in size until house-sized or even larger (takes decades to centuries)
• don't die of old age
• at old age only enemies are old krakens and dragons
• hibernate for decades, consuming ambient magic and krill to gather energy for active phases
• surprisingly stealthy if not moving - mostly because they look like part of the landscape
• wake mostly to lay eggs or defend territory agains other tenticrablodon of equal size
• very destructive - like to destroy geography by sharpening claws, rubbing shell
• extremely sturdy and stubborn - very hard to affect with magic
surprisingly agile and aware in combat, actively uses hard shell to defend
• tentacles are very quick and whirl about wildly in combat, making even approach dangerous
